summary: I NEED TO KNOW IF THIS VEHICLE IS A GMC OR CHEVY BECAUSE I HAVE TAKEN IT TO THE MECHANIC MANY OCCASIONS AND I ALWAYS HAVE PROBLEMS WITH PARTS THAT DON'T FIT. NO I HAVE ALWAYS HAD PROBLEMS WITH THE STEERING IT'S VERY HARD TO CONTROL WHILE DRIVING I PICKING UP TWO MECHANICS DIFFERENT TIMES RELATING THAT ISSUE AND THEY SAY EVERYTHING IS FINE BUT IT REALLY ISN'T I PURCHASED THIS VEHICLE USE I WOULD ALSO LIKE TO KNOW IF THERE ARE ANY RECALLSOR IF IT HAS BEEN INVOLVED IN MAJOR ACCIDENTS THANK YOU VERY MUCH

GET IN THE TRUCK WHEN ITS COLD STARTS ON FIRST TRY. YOU DRIVE THE TRUCK WHEN IT GETS  HOT AND STOP TO PURCHASE SOMETHING THEN YOU GET BACK INTO THE TRUCK PUT THE KEY IN THE IGNITION TRY TO START . IT WILL NOT START JUST CRANKS . I HAVE TO LET THE TRUCK SIT FOR ABOUT 10 TO 15 MINUTES THEN IT MAY START. THIS PROBLEM HAS COST ME (2) NEW FUEL PUMPS AT THE GM DEALERS STRANDED ME IN THE PARKING LOTS IN THE DESERT TOWING ETC.  AFTER RESEARCHING THEY SAY IT IS A PASS LOCK PROBLEM SOMETHING ABOUT SECURITY/ THEFT. I'M THE ORIGINAL OWNER TRUCK WAS ALWAYS HARD TO START MORE THAN3TO 4 CRANKS.  WHY HASN'T THIS BEEN ON A RECALL FOR GM?

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1999 CHEVROLET SILVERADO 3500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THERE HAD BEEN EXTREME HESITATION WITH THE ENGINE POWER. THE SERVICE ENGINE WARNING LIGHT RANDOMLY ILLUMINATED FOR YEARS AND THE PART FAILED TO FUNCTION PROPERLY. THE CONTACT REPLACED THE ENGINE TWICE BY A CERTIFIED MECHANIC AND, DUE TO THE FAILURE CONTINUING, THE VEHICLE WAS DIAGNOSED BY A MECHANIC WHO STATED THAT THE PART WOULD NEED TO BE REPLACED A THIRD TIME. A MECHANIC STATED THAT THERE WERE FIVE STRESS FRACTURES IN THE ENGINE BLOCK PREMATURELY. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE AND PROVIDED NO SOLUTION. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 50,000. UPDATED 08/16/16*LJ  CONSUMER STATED LOT OF PROBLEMS WITH THE ENGINE. EVERY MECHANIC CONSUMER SPOKEN TO ABOUT THE 6.5 CHEVY TURBO DIESEL SAID THE SAME THING "THEY ARE JUNK" THE BLOCKS CRACK AND THEY DON'T LAST. SINCE I HAVE CONTACTED YOU THE ENGINE HAS BEEN PULLED AND THERE ARE 12 STRESS CRACKS IN THE ENGINE INSTEAD OF 5. UPDATED 06/12/18*JB
PUT BRAKES ON,BRAKE LINE BROKE. LOOKED AT LINES ALL RUSTED VARY BAD.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1999 CHEVROLET C3500 DIESEL TRUCK. WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 30 MPH THE VEHICLE STALLED. THE VEHICLE WAS PUSHED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD. THE CONTACT STATED THAT SHE WAITED APPROXIMATELY 15 MINUTES AND THE VEHICLE STARTED. THE FAILURE WAS INTERMITTENT. CHEVROLET REPLACED THE ENGINE IN MAY OF 2002 AT 63,000 MILES. IN JULY 2003, THE DEALER REPLACED THE FUEL INJECTIONS AT 67,000 MILES. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER SEVERAL TIMES FOR OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS AT AN AUTHORIZED DEALER WHEN THE REPORT WAS FILED. THE DEALER ORDERED A FUEL PUMP FOR THE VEHICLE BUT THE MANUFACTURER WOULD NOT PAY FOR IT. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 62,000 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 75,000 MILES.

components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,PARKING BRAKE,ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE,EQUIPMENT
summary: CHASSIS ENGINE FAILED ON SINGLE LANE HIGHWAY HILL CLIMB. SEEMED LIKE ENGINE CUT OFF ALLOWING DRIVER TO QUICKLY  TURN INTO" HOLE IN THE WALL "QUICK STOP STORE PARKING AREA. ENGINE TURNED OVER BUT WOULD NOT RUN. *TR  THE CONSUMER STATED HE EXPERIENCED TWO PARKING BRAKE FAILURES WITHIN 3,000 MILES OF TRAVEL. EACH REPAIR, CONSISTED OF REPLACING SWITCHES AND ADJUSTMENTS.  THE LAST REPAIR CONSISTED OF THE REPLACEMENT OF THE DRUM ASSOCIATED WITH THE BRAKE PADS, SWITCHES AND WHEEL BRAKE DISC. IT WAS ALSO DISCOVERED THAT THE PARK ASSEMBLY HAD BURNED UP, WHEN THE BRAKE ASSEMBLY FAILED TO RELEASE. IN ADDITION, A 10 AMP FUSE HAD BLOWN WHEN A SHORT WAS DISCOVERED IN A PRESSURE SWITCH. THE PARK BRAKE ASSEMBLY AND BOTH PRESSURE SWITCHES WERE REPLACED. UPDATED IVOQ 12/19/12  THE CONSUMER STATED WHILE FILLING RE-FUELING THE MOTOR HOME, A PASSERBY INFORMED HIM GASOLINE WAS DRAINING FROM THE MOTOR HOME. HE QUICKLY REMOVED THE HOSE AND SAW A LARGE PUDDLE OF FUEL UNDER THE GAS TANK. THE CONSUMER WAS NOT SURE, WHERE IT WAS COMING FROM, BUT IT DID APPEAR TO FLOW FROM A CONNECTING PIPE AT THE VERY REAR OF THE  MOTOR HOME FILLING SECTION AND ABOUT 4 INCHES AT THE TANK INTERFACE. THE CONSUMER STATED THE  MOTOR HOME IS CURRENTLY IN STORAGE. UPDATED 04/30/13
UNWANTED ABS BRAKE ACTIVATION
PAINT PEELING ON HOOD AND BED, SUBMITTED TO GM FOR MANUFACTURE DEFFECT AND TO REPAINT TRUCK , IT WAS DENIED DUE TO AGE OF TRUCK , MILEAGE OF TRUCK IS 71,000.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1999 CHEVROLET C3500.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT A TIRE DEALER DISCOVERED OIL ON THE REAR BRAKES WHILE PERFORMING A ROUTINE INSPECTION.  THE CONTACT WAS DRIVING 50 MPH BEFORE ARRIVING AT THE DEALER.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE REAR DRIVE AXLE OIL SEALS FAILED AND CAUSED THE OIL LEAK.  AS OF AUGUST 23, 2007, NO REPAIRS HAVE BEEN MADE.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 52,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1999 CHEVROLET SILVERADO 35000.  WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH THE VEHICLE SHUT OFF WITHOUT WARNING.  SHE HAD TO PUT THE VEHICLE IN NEUTRAL TO RESTART.  APPROXIMATELY AN HOUR LATER THE VEHICLE SHUT OFF AGAIN.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE FUEL PUMP FAILED.  AS OF AUGUST 3, 2007, THE DEALER HAS NOT REPAIRED THE VEHICLE.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 10,000 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 20,000.  RETURN USPS, MADE 2ND ATTEMPT 08/03/07 FAILED. *BF
1999 SILVERADO 3500 TIRE AND RIM ROLLED OFF VEHICLE.  *TS  THE TIRE AND RIM CAME OFF THE VEHICLE DUE TO CRACKED/BROKEN STUDS. *JB

summary: 11/09/04 I HAD TO REPLACE DIFFERENTIAL ASSEMBLY: OVERHAUL/REBUILD FRONT, REPLACE BRAKE PAD (BENDIX)3/10/05 REPLACED IDLER ARM. 3/23/05 REPLACED PITMAN ARM. 10/25/05 6.5 LITER DIESEL ELECTRONIC PUMP (PMD) FAILURE. TRUCK WAS MOVING ON IT'S ON,  JERKING, BLACK SMOKE CAME FROM TAIL PIPE AND TIRES WOULD SPIN THEN IT CUT OFF AND  WOULDN'T START. CALLED WRECKER AND HAD IT TAKEN TO AUTO SHOP. HE REPLACED PMD MODULE KIT WITH A NOTE TO LEAVE PLASTIC COVER OFF ENGINE BECAUSE OF HEAT BUILD UP. 6/25/06 SAME THING HAPPENED. CALLED WRECKER AND HAD IT TAKEN TO AUTO SHOP. THIS TIME HE REPLACED FUEL PUMP ON FRAME RAIL. 6/29/06 FUEL FILTER RINGS BLEW OFF, IT STARTED  POURING FUEL ONTO HIGHWAY, JERKING,TRUCK MOVING ON IT'S ON, BLACK SMOKE COMING FROM TAIL PIPE WOULDN'T STOP HAD TO HOLD BREAK TO FLOOR UNTIL IT STALLED. ALMOST HIT A BUILDING.  *JB

2002 -COOLANT LEAKING FROM ENGINE AT APPROX  33,000 MILES. DIAGNOSED AS INTAKE MANIFOLD GASKET AND CORRECTED BY CHEVROLET DEALER UNDER WARRANTY. 2005 64000 MILES -COOLANT LEAKING FROM ENGINE COMPARTMENT, DISCOVERED CRACKED RADIATOR, REPLACED AT MY EXPENSE. 2005 66,000 MILES -COOLANT LEAKING FROM ENGINE COMPARTMENT, REPLACED WATER PUMP. MY EXPENSE. 2005 70,000 MILES-COOLANT  LEAKING FROM ENGINE COMPARTMENT, DIAGNOSED INTAKE MANIFOLD GASKET AGAIN, REPLACED AT MY EXPENSE. PREMATURE WEAR OF  BRAKE PADS AND  DRUMS.   DEALER HAS PUT 4 SETS OF PADS AND DRUMS ON  VEHICLE.*AK  CONSUMER STATES THAT REAR DRUMS DO NOT ADJUST PROPERLY, WHICH CAUSE THE FRONT BRAKE PADS TO WEAR AT APPROXIMATELY 10000 MILES, SOMETIMES BRAKES SMOKE AND RATTLE.   *SLC

summary: I HAVE AN APPOINTMENT TO SERVICE THE TRUCK BUT I DON'T KNOW I F THE PROBLEMS WILL WE SOLVED. NO SAFETY DEFECT LISTED IN SUMMARY.  *AK

WHEN RELEASING  ACCELERATOR PEDAL  VEHICLE WILL NOT SLOW DOWN AND IT WILL MAINTAIN SPEED. DEALER HAS ATTEMPTED TO FIX DEFECT, BUT WAS NOT ABLE TO.  PRESENTLY, DEALER  CLAIMED  IT  WAS NORMAL CHARACTERISTIC.*AK   PCM FAILURE CAUSE THE VEHICLE NOT TO SLOW DOWN WHEN ACCELERATOR IS RELEASED.  *YH

WHILE DRIVING  RPM'S WILL STAY AT 2025 FOR ABOUT 10 SECONDS AFTER DRIVER HAS LET OFF THE ACCELERATOR. A TECHINCAL INSPECTOR FROM  BBB INSPECTED VEHICLE AND ALSO NOTICED THIS DEFECT.  ENGINE WILL NOT DECELERATE. PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK

ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT ON A 1999, CHEVROLET, C3500, LT245/75R16.   TREAD SEPARATED ON THE LEFT REAR AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS.*AK  THE CUSTOMER WAS TRAVELING AT 65 MPH AT 90 DEGREE TEMPREATURE WHEN THE TREAD SEPARATED COMPLETELY.  *YH

WHILE DRIVING AT 50 MPH VEHICLE BEGAN TO SHAKE OR SHIMMY IN  REAR END. SHIMMYING GOT WORSE AT HIGHER SPEEDS.  THIS COULD CAUSE DRIVER TO LOSE CONTROL.  ALSO,  CAUSED TOWING OBJECTS TO FISHTAIL. TRUCK WAS TAKEN TO TWO DEALERSHIPS. EACH DEALERSHIP STATED THAT THIS WAS A CHRACTERISTIC OF  VEHICLE.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION. *AK

WHEN TAKING FOOT OFF THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL  VEHICLE WILL MAINTAIN SPEED ,IT WILL NOT GO INTO IDLE. DEALER HAS REPLACED THROTTLE BODY, AND HAS RESET COMPUTER.  BUT DEFECT STILL OCCURS.  DEALER NOW CLAIMS IT IS A NORMAL CHARACTERISTIC.*AK
VEHICLE PULLED TO THE LEFT WHEN THE BRAKES WERE APPLIED.  DEALER HAS REPLACED  THE BRAKE PADS AND SHOES/CALIPERS AND  IDLER PITMAN ARM.   MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.

VEHICLES  BRAKES DO NOT RELEASE THEY STICK FREQUENTLY WEARING BRAKE PADS OUT. THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN IN SERVICE 7 TIMES FOR BRAKE PROBLEMS AND DEALER STATE THEY CANNOT FIND ANYTHING WRONG. HOWEVER THEY HAVE REPLACED THE BRAKE PADS 3 TIMES DUE TO IRREGULAR BRAKE WARE ON THE PAD. THE BRAKES WILL PULL SERVELY TO THE LEFT AT ANY GIVEN TIME CAUSING VEHICLE TO PULL TO THE LEFT INTO OTHER LANE OF TRAFFIC. *AK
INTERMITTENTLY WHILE BRAKING  STEERING MALFUNCTIONED, CAUSING  VEHICLE TO GO TO THE RIGHT UNEXPECTEDLY WHICH MAY CAUSE A CRASH.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK
WHEN  BRAKE PEDAL IS APPLIED BRAKES BEGAN TO GRIND, AND THERE WAS EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE. DEALER HAS BEEN CONTACTED.  *AK
CONSUM HAD REPLACE BRAKES FIRST. THEN, WHEN HE APPLIED THE BRAKES, PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR. A TECHNICIAN TOLD CONSUMER THE PROBLEM WAS WITH THE BRAKE REAR SEALS.  *AK

WHEN  CONSUMER PUTS  FOOT ON THE BRAKES TRUCK PULLS TO THE RIGHT, AND IT MAKES A LOUD SQUEALING NOISE. ALSO,  THEY GRAB  AS IF THEY ARE STOPPING TOO FAST.  DEALER CAN'T FIND THE CAUSE OF THE  PROBLEM. CONSUMER INDICATED IF IT WAS RAINING IT WOULD BE A PROBLEM WITH THE BRAKES.  *AK
TRUCK SURGES WHILE IN GEAR-IN BOTH DRIVE AND REVERSE

INTERMITTENTLY WHEN  THE BRAKES ARE APPLIED THE PADAL GOES TO THE FLOOR, RESULTING IN EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE DUE TO AIR GETTING IN THE SYSTEM.  DEALER HAS INSPECTED AND REPAIRED THE VEHICLE SEVERCEL TIMES.  *AK

EXHAUST WHICH  IS TOO CLOSE TO FLOOR BOARDS  GETS OVERHEATED ON PASSENGER'S SIDE. THIS CAUSES THE PASSENGER TO PUT FEET ON DASHBOARD DUE TO HOT FLOOR BOARDS. BEEN TO DEALER & INFORMED BY MECHANIC THE PROBLEM CAN NOT BE SOLVED. *AK

FRONT BRAKES WEAR OUT ABOUT EVERY 4,000 MILES. ON AUGUST 24TH, THE FRONT BRAKES WENT OUT TOTALLY, WHICH COULD HAVE RESULTED IN A CRASH . THIS HAPPENED DURING NORMAL STOPPING.   PADS HAVE BEEN REPLACED 4 TIMES  BUT PROBLEM  WAS NOT SOLVED. DEALER CONTACTED, AWARE OF BRAKE PROBLEM, BUT ALL THEY ARE ALLOWED TO DO IS REPLACED THE PADS. *AK *ML
WHILE DRIVING THE CAR WILL STEER  BY ITSELF INTO OTHER TRAFFIC LANES.DEALER WAS CONTACTED,  AND STATED THAT IT WAS THE FRONT END ALIGNMENT.  *AK
FRONT BRAKES FAILED, CAUSING  VEHICLE TO PULL TO THE LEFT AND RIGHT SIDES.  *AK *ML
WHILE TRAVELING AND WHEN MAKING A SUDDEN STOP BY DEPRESSING THE BRAKE PEDAL TO THE FLOOR BOARD, BRAKES LOCKED UP, RESULTING IN VEHICLE SKIDDING. PLEASE PROVE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK

CONSUMER OWNS TWO CHEVROLET TRUCKS G3500, 99 VEHICLES, AND HAS  EXPERIENCED VEHICLE  PULLING TO ONE SIDE OR THE OTHER WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES.
